oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: National Trust for Historic Preservation Membership Card, Margaret Croft
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Membership card for the National Trust for Historic Preservation issued to Margaret Croft. On the back of the card, National Trust properties are listed with their addresses.

In 1949, the National Trust for Historic Preservation, a nonprofit organization, was established with the purpose to save and maintain historic properties and sites throughout the United States. In 1956, it would become a membership organization. Over the years, the organization expanded their mission to include helping with funding, creating outreach projects, and providing resources to the public. Nashville is one of 12 cities with a field office.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: National Trust for Historic Preservation in the United States
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Historic preservation; Historic buildings--Conservation and restoration; Historic sites--Conservation and restoration
